intro: Dichaetanthera amphorocalyx, commonly known as the bottle-gourd orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, with elongated, bottle-shaped petals that enclose the reproductive organs. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are often fragrant and attract specific pollinators such as bees and moths. The botanical features of Dichaetanthera amphorocalyx make it a distinctive and ecologically important species within its habitat.
